data.title: Installing 1.6.0.p17 on SLES15 SP1
data.meta_description:
Hi, 
The check-mk-enterprise-1.6.0p17-sles15sp1-38.x86_64.rpm lists “xinetd” as a dependency, however the xinetd was removed from this distribution. 
What is the proper way to deploy the CheckMK server on SLES15 SP1 ? 
T…
data.text:
Hi,

The check-mk-enterprise-1.6.0p17-sles15sp1-38.x86_64.rpm lists “xinetd” as a dependency, however the xinetd was removed from this distribution.

What is the proper way to deploy the CheckMK server on SLES15 SP1 ?

Thanks

Hi @athomaidis.

Unfortunately that won’t help. The OP asked about the installation of the checkmk server which has a requirement in its RPM package for xinetd.

It is needed for the livestatus daemon. The commands omd config set LIVESTATUS_TCP… basically manipulate the (per-site) xinetd configuration.

But you are right, the agent can be operated without xinetd. Its RPM has no special Requires statements.

Cheers,

Dirk

Indeed I am talking about the server and not the agent.

@r.sander: I do have the “web and scripting” module and the “development tools” module configured as suggested in the documentation but the xinetd is not available in any of them.

@Dirk: The repository you suggested only provides xinetd for SLES15 but not for SLES15 SP1.

I am still looking for a solution here…

Actually Dirk’s suggestion worked !

I went ahead and downloaded the SLES15 version of xinetd from the link he suggested and I was able to install that on my SLES15 SP1 (I was expecting to get a warning about a distro mismatch…)

Afterwards the cmk server installation was possible without any further issues.

Maybe someone can update the documentation related to SLES15 SP1 installation procedure.

Many thanks !

@fayepal, while you are at it you may also want to discuss Nagvis crash due to missing dependency in rhel8 installer

The problem is that the checkmk-enterprise RPM package does not explicitely mention the dependency

Requires: php-json

Yet, this package is needed if Nagvis is used, e.g. to display maps.
